reviewText: It's a bit repetitive. Also, it describes the 1968 Democratic Convention as a "Marvelous Turning Point"; freedom; youth movement, etc. Are you kidding??? It was a ZOO. The Pick Congress windows were smashed, stores looted, rocks and bottles thrown at the Police----a terrible time for the city and those of us (while young) still had half a brain compared to the imported rebel throngs.
I'm in it with my friend when the Beatles came to Chicago. We were helping to hold the "we love you Beatles " banner. But besides that this is a great DVD showing everything ng in Chicago's past
Great collection of stories, photos and home movies by Chicagoans who were alive in the 50s and 60s.
This DVD is a great gift for parents from the boomer generation
If you grew up around Chicago in the 1960's this is so good. Brings back memories. Fun to watch.
